title: Page 314
content: 2.21 Testosterone introductionTestosterone is an important but misunderstood molecule as most hormones are.Increasing one’s testosterone levels can both help him and harm him.Testosterone for example can help anxiety but it can also cause anxiety if wedon’t look at things holistically.Not looking things holistically in the human body might be good for instagramposts and grabbing people’s attention, but are we actually helping someone atthe end of the day with this half-knowledge we present?Testosterone (and other androgens) are anabolic.The term anabolic describes growth where cells actually increase in size notachieved by inflammation and swelling.Anabolism, rather than inflammation, is where cells create structures which arepersistent and lasting.My personal testosterone numbers are at 980-ish and obviously all the otherimportant numbers are also on point. I’ve gone from 700-ish all the way to1200-ish (naturally) and from what i’ve experienced myself and clients and readover the last 7 years, for most people the ideal range is between 800 and 1050.The first distinction we must make when discussing testosterone, is to startthinking about “unopposed” testosterone since elevated testosterone is not theonly metric that matters.Now here are the basic lab tests that you can get in order to better understandyour current androgen health.The best time to test androgens is 9-10A.M since they peak early on the day andcan show a false positive result.•First we have total testosteroneⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 315
content: This is the testosterone that is also bound to albumin and SHBG.The normal range for free testosterone is 600 - 1000 ng/dL but from working withmany clients, ideally you want a range of 800+ng/dL.We cover the best nutrients to optimize testosterone on the lethal T nutrientcombo (see page..)•Then we have your free testosterone which is the testosterone that is not boundto SHBG or albumin and is often referred to as bioactive testosterone. 2-4% ofthe total testosterone levels is bioactive.Ideally you want a range of70-200 pg/mL of free testosterone.The best nutrients to optimize free testosterone are vitamin D, magnesium andboron.•Then we have estradiol and prolactin which when elevated destroy men’s fertility,libido, thyroid and mood.Ideally when it comes to estradiol levels you want a range of 10–40 pg/mL andprolactin levels below 17 ng/ml.The best nutrients to optimize prolactin are taurine, vitamin D and K2.•Then we have SHBG (sex hormone binding globulin) which is a protein thatbinds to testosterone (the more SHBG you have the less your free testosterone).Ideally when it comes to SHBG you want levels of 15 - 40 nmol/L.In order to optimize SHBG first pay special attention to the xenoestrogen detoxpart and focus on the thyroid supportive diet plan for up to 4 weeks which hasmany of the nutrients you need to lower SHBG such as vitamin E, choline,vitamin C and so on.• Last but definitely not least, we have LH and FSH which stimulate sperm andtestosterone production.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 316
content: Ideally you want a range of 3 - 10 mIU/L.A few things that specifically trigger more LHandFSH production are: cistanche(will help both LH and FSH equally), ginger (will favor LH more) (ginger isextremely effective and in just 90-days it showed a 43% increase in LH and a17% increase in FSH in hypogonadal men), taurine and mucuna.2.22 Anti-testosterone compoundsNow let’s take a look at a few“anti-testosteronecompounds”aka compoundsthat act as testosterone blockers besides PUFAs, xenoestrogens and so on.Number 1: Stress hormonesStress hormones counteract the effects of testosterone partly by promoting itsaromatization into estrogen.Stress hormones slow both the production of testosterone and progesteronewhile also elevating oppositional hormones such as estrogen and cortisol.Cortisol catabolizes muscle like very few things do.Anyone who has experienced an intense stressful period realizes that it’s almostimpossible to gain or even maintain muscle at this state.Why is that?Well the cortisol molecule is a competitor to the testosterone molecule whichmeans that they compete for the same receptors and locations in the body’stissues.The effects of cortisol are aso cumulative, ending up causing more and moredamage as time passes.So what causes the most intense spikes in stress hormones and thus destroystestosterone levels?ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 317
content: First, alcohol.The body responds to stress through a hormone system called thehypothalamic-pituitary adrenal (HPA) axis.Stimulation of this system results in the secretion of stress hormones (i.e.,glucocorticoids).Alcohol activates the HPA axis and results in elevated glucocorticoid levels.Alcohol does not increase cortisol only for a few hours as some stimulants do, butfor days.So, you can not be a regular drinker and have proper functioning androgens.Avoid it as often as you can and if you are a regular drinker eliminate it for at least8 weeks.Then we have overtraining.Most natural lifters train way too much.Way too much.Muscle building is not only a matter of tearing up muscle fibers.This is ridiculous and the statement more pain more gain even more ridiculous.Gorillas sit all day and have wider shoulders than Mr Olympia.If muscle building was only a matter of training, women who workout just as hardas us would have the same muscle mass as we have.But they have not.Unopposed testosterone is the real muscle builder, not training.If you are a natural lifter, the ideal weight lifting volume depends first of all on yourlifestyle.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 318
content: Are you a new parent who is sleep deprived and works 17 hours a day forexample?Are you a person with a regular 9-5?Are you a college student?The first metric you should use in order to understand if weightlifting is going tocause an excess spike in stress hormones is if you can train for 30-40 minuteswithout a stimulant.If you can, then you can go workout.If not, rest or go for a walk.Then we have not sleeping enough.Are you sleeping well?If not, there’s no wonder why your testosterone is at 300.Focusing on optimizing your circadian rhythm as demonstrated in lesson 1 willgreatly improve your entire hormonal health and thus testosterone.Then we have the fasting paranoia.Fasting is a strategic tool, not a lifestyle.“But fasting makes me feel good”.Well cocaine and crazy chicks would make you feel good too.But fasting (and crazy chicks) make you “feel” good from all the adrenaline andnot because it’s actually good for your health.Fasting (and crazy chicks) will actually destroy your metabolism if you don’t knowwhat you’re doing.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 319
content: It is way better to do a 3 day fast every month than it is fast for 23 hours everyday.Get 3 meals a day in if you care about optimizing androgens.A breakfast, a lunch and a dinner.Especially breakfast.Cortisol levels climax early in the morning and if you are like most people whodon’t eat a proper breakfast that has a good amount of protein, a good amount offats and a good amount of carbs (eggs and fruit basically) and drink 400mg ofcaffeine, you’re catabolizing even further.Fructose (fruit) is also a great tool to lower cortisol and i recommend two servingsof fruit daily in case you’re not suffering from candida (see lesson 1).One in the morning and one at night.So, eat.Then we have an inflammatory diet.Are you nurturing your body with food or are you making it even more stressed byeating garbage that it has to go on panic mode in order to process them?What does your diet consist of?Does it consist of grains that tend to raise estrogen?Does it consist of seed oils like canola oil that mess up everything?Try sticking to : meat (both organs and some muscle meat), raw dairy once in awhile, quality fats such as coconut oil, some bone broth rice and fruit for a while. ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 320
content: Then we have an overworked liver through xenoestrogens and a ton ofsupplementsXenoestrogens and tons of supplements are a huge burden to the liver which isresponsible for proper thyroid function.So avoid xenoestrogens as much as you can while detoxing from them (seelesson 1) and treat supplements as specific tools.You would be surprised with how many people actually consume over 20 pills ofsupplements per day.A common cause is also sun exposure without enough antioxidants, zincand cholesterol.Sun is not a problem but can be a big stressor if the right things are not providedthrough one’s diet.If you spend a lot of time in the sun (the ideal number for health reasons seemsto be 2 hours a day) make sure to consume animal foods from muscle meats toeggs and also you might need to supplement with vitamin C and eat some kernelpalm oil.Stress will also deplete nutrient stores such as: copper, magnesium, vitamin C,vitamin A, B vitamins, sodium and even vitamin K which all play a key role fortestosterone production.In order to lower stress hormones and thus improve androgen health, trythe following.#1 Ground twice dailyGrounding restores and maintains the body’s natural electrical state which in turnpromotes optimum health.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 321
content: Your body becomes suffused with negative charged free electrons that arepresent on the surface of the Earth and your body equalizes to the same electricenergy level as the Earth.Free electrons from grounding reduce oxidative stress produced by EMFs.Grounding reduces inflammation and improves blood flow which result in calmingarrhythmias, lowering blood pressure and improving blood oxygenation.Get as many minutes as you can during the day and consider purchasing somegrounding sandals.#2 Fructose (fruit)Fructose lowers cortisol and boosts your metabolism in a level so phenomenal itwould be stupid to ignore.Carbohydrates are the most efficient source of energy we humans have accessto.Fruits also produce way more CO2 than fats and protein in general and CO2 is agood thing since it decreases oxidative damage.#3 Magnesium and sea saltIt is a fact that most people are magnesium deficient.Magnesium deficiency can lead to glutamate overactivity.Salt will help balance insulin which always gets out of whack during stressfulperiods.#4 NACNAC can be pretty effective for lowering cortisol and you might want to give it atry.Just make sure to have enough copper from your weekly organ meats.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 322
content: #5 Do a dopamine detoxOverstimulation can in fact cause a rapid increase in stress hormones and mostpeople today are overstimulated.It’s almost impossible to avoid this unless you plan on strategic dopamine fast.My personal recommendation are spending some time in relative silenceeveryday (go for a walk in nature) and one regular dopamine detox for 2-3 daysevery month.#6 250mg of vitamin C and 25-50mg of quality vitamin E or palm kernel oil 4times a week.The adrenal glands dump vitamin C when cortisol is released and it is best tosupplement with a low dose in case you’re having (or had) a pretty stressfullifestyle.Also vitamin C is vital not only to produce healthy cholesterol but to utilize it aswell. Note: Vitamin C requires sodium to be absorbed into the body so don’t skipsea salt.#7 Saturated fatsKeep the saturated fats at least at 25% of your daily calories (just do not combinehigh fat with high carb) and PUFAs as low as you can.Rats who were fed coconut oil for example daily for 60 days, had a)lower stresslevels in their testes and b)significantly higher testosterone levels compared tothose who were fed olive oil, soybean oil, canola oil etc. Saturated fats arenecessary for our health.#8 Copper (obviously do not over do it)Replacement of copper by iron in someone’s diet will dramatically increaseestrogen (a stress hormone) so addressing unbound iron as you saw in lesson 1ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 323
content: and including a nice source of copper:zinc in someone’s diet, will be beneficial aswell.#8 Other things you can use to reduce cortisol and stress hormones are:liquorice extract (it inhibits the enzyme 11B HSD), siberian (avoid panax) ginseng,B vitamins and if you are over 27, short term and low dose DHEA andpregnenolone use.Number 2: AromataseThe aromatase enzyme activity is a natural process to keep homeostasis in themale and female body.Aromatase, also known as estrogen synthase, is a member of the cytochromeP450 superfamily which can flip high amounts of testosterone into estrogen.In order to optimize aromatase, first someone needs to minimize stress with theways we just saw and also eliminate alcohol.Then he can use some dietary aromatase inhibitors such as palm kernel oil,EVOO, citrus fruits (orange juice, pomegranate and grapefruit juice with no pulp),chamomile and mushrooms.Number 3: SHBGSex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) binds to sex hormones in the so SHBGbinds to testosterone and an increase in SHBG can be detrimental to freetestosterone levels.If someone wants to lower SHBG, first he needs to stop consuming alcohol anddetox from xenoestrogens.Then he can use magnesium and boron.Magnesium binds to SHBG and boron supplementation has been shown todecrease SHBG levels as well besides sunlight which is probably the mosteffective way to decrease SHBG.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 324
content: Optimizing glucose metabolism will also be crucial since SHBG can be increasedby insulin resistance.Number 4: PhytoestrogensPhytoestrogens are present in certain edible plants being most abundant in soy,they are structurally and functionally analogous to the estrogen and have alsobeen classified as endocrine disruptors.Endocrine disruptors are chemicals that can interfere with endocrine (orhormone) systems at certain doses.These disruptions can cause cancerous tumors, birth defects, and otherdevelopmental disorders.Phytoestrogens can manipulate steroid biosynthesis and transport by for examplestimulating SHBG synthesis in liver cells, and displacing either 17β-estradiol ortestosterone from plasma SHBG.This deflection of the quantity or availability of SHBG by phytoestrogens changesthe free fraction of endogenous hormones in circulation systemically or locally.Even though some studies (some of them good and some of them bad) haveshown some benefits for women, it is better to avoid phytoestrogens for men andalso for anyone who is under 21 since some studies have shown increasedinfertility.What you should avoid most :- Soy/Soy products- Flax- Tempeh- Sesame seeds- BeerⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 325
content: Number 5: Phytic acid, lignans, glycyrrhizic acid and beta glucan.Phytic acid is a substance which easily and readily binds to many essentialminerals and nutrients in the body. In a study reviewing this substance, scientistsconcluded that the consumption of foods which contain Phytic Acid is likely themain reason humans all across the world have micronutrient deficiencies.Lignans are an estrogenic compound to the point of doctors using lignans inorder to decrease testosterone levels in women who experience hightestosterone.Glycyrrhizic acid has been shown to reduce testosterone levels by blocking itsproduction in the Leydig cells in the testes. Glycyrrhizic acid can lowertestosterone by up to 300 ng/dL in just 4 days (look it up).Beta glucan has been promoted as a “cholesterol lowering substance”.The problem with this is that beta glucan is a powerful anti-androgen compound.2.23 Pro testosterone food list1)Free range eggsFree range eggs are an excellent source of bioavailable protein, choline,selenium, vitamin A, vitamin K, B vitamins, saturated fats, cholesterol and containall the elements that a little chicken needs to be born.When having eggs, do not drink them raw. The raw egg whites will destroy yourstomach and deplete you of B vitamins (the egg whites are there to protect theyolk).Instead cook the eggs until the egg whites are cooked but the yolks remain raw.How many should you consume? 2-5 eggs a day are enough.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 326
content: After this, there are actually not many benefits (i’ve had many clients that theirhealth was wrecked from drinking 12 eggs a day) and if you are not micronutrientbalanced already (most are not) there can be some side effects as well.2)Raw dairyRaw dairy are an excellent source of pro testosterone nutrients such as zinc,vitamin A, CLA and even iron binders such as lactoferrin.Raw dairy products are an excellent source of milk bioavailable calcium andvitamin K2 and as we saw, since most people consume way too muchphosphorus and not enough calcium, raw dairy will greatly help their thyroid andthus metabolic health.Raw milk is also a great recovery tool due to the high L glutamine amount.3)Grass fed/organic organ meats (especially beef and goose liver).Organ meats are the most nutrient dense foods on the planet and you shouldalways invest in them first.100 grams of organic/grass fed liver will provide way more nutrients than 100gr oforganic fruit. It’s not even comparable.They obviously both have their place in a proper diet though*Organ meats are an excellent source of B vitamins such as folate, biotin, B12 andB6, zinc, selenium, iron, choline, vitamin A, copper, vitamin K2, coenzyme Q10and zinc.Recommended organ meats are: Beef liver, beef heart, beef kidneys, chickenlivers and goose liver.You can consume organ meats any time you want but if you want to boost mentalperformance it is best to be consumed in the morning and if you want to boostsex at night.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 327
content: 4)Oysters and shellfish (preferably raw)Oysters and shellfish are the best sources of selenium and zinc. They have anincredible amino acid balance and greatlty help the production of sex hormonesD-Aspartic-Acid and N-Methyl-D-Aspartate (NMDA).Cooking the oysters does decrease the amount of these amino acids though soit’s best to be eaten raw.You can cook other shellfish such as crab, shrimp or mussels that are incrediblyhigh in glycine.The best time to consume oysters is 4-7 hours prior to bed time/sex aka at lunch.5)Coconut oil and EVOOIn many experiments, rats who were fed coconut oil daily had lower stress levelsin their testes and significantly higher testosterone levels.The caprylic acid in coconut oil(a type of saturatedfatty acid) also hasantibacterial, antiviral, antifungal and anti-inflammatory properties and canspeedup the T4 to T3 conversion.When it comes to EVOO, since a lot of them are laced with inferior oils, makesure that your EVOO is in a glass bottle and has a deep dark green/golden-ishcolor. It should also become solid when refrigerated.EVOO consumed daily, can increase testosterone by up to 17% in 3 weeks.6)Pomegranate juice (no pulp)Pomegranate juice is a health elixir.One study in people with diabetes showed that 1 cup of pomegranate juicelowered CRP and interleukin-6 ( inflammatory markers that cancer patients haveelevated) by 30-32%.Citrus fruit can also bind SHBG.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 328
content: Testosterone wise, a study showed a 24% increase in saliva testostosterone injust 14 days of consuming pomegranates.Pomegranate juice has also been shown to increase the 1rp of olympic athletes.The juice part is important since pomegranates contain one of the highest levelsof phytoestrogens.Drinking only the juice should help you avoid these though, as it is typically theflesh and seeds which contain phytoestrogen.I recommend pomegranate juice pre or post lift and when sunbathing.7)Local raw honeyRaw honey is a great enzyme, mineral and trace mineral source.Only four tablespoons contain the daily requirements of many of them such aspotassium and even boron.Local raw honey will also provide some immunity against pollen allergens.8)(Raw) Garlic and onionsBesides being a great antibacterial, garlic contains allicin which lowers cortisollevels and this can improve testosterone.It also contains diallyl disulfide which can increase testosterone levels in thetestes.Onions are an excellent source of B6, allicin and quercetin and can increasetestosterone levels by over 100% in 4 weeks.Both of these were also mentioned in the sulfur part and will also help in ironhomeostasis.9)Grass fed/finished red meatAim for grass finished meats if you can to avoid chemicals or traces of antibiotics.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 329
content: Non grass finished cows are treated with extra estrogen since it pseudo helpsthem to grow faster (in reality it just produces more inflamed muscle tissue) andthis leeches into their meat.Obviously red meat is a great source of zinc, a lot of B vitamins and selenium.10)Brazil nutsBrazil nuts (besides targeted sprouted almond supplementation) are the only nutsi recommend someone consume occasionally.They are rich in selenium, vitamin E, zinc, magnesium, they have a good-ishsaturated/unsaturated fat ratio (2:1) and they are low in phytosterol.That being said, do not consume more than 3-4 a day.11) Raisins and red grapesThese are a great source of boron and resveratrol which has been linked toTestosterone production and lower estrogen levels in men.Chinese researchers found that around 500mg (the amount in 5-10g) of redgrape skins was enough to raise testosterone levels, and increase sperm swimstrength.12)White button mushroomsWhite button mushrooms are great to decrease estrogen and remove endotoxinsbesides them being high in vitamin B6.The polysaccharides in them have been shown to block the effects of thearomatase enzyme.13)White fishI want to attack all the metrosexuals that say white fish are filled withmicroplastics and thus have zero clue of the digestive system of these animals.Shrimp is another story*ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 330
content: White fish are an excellent source of minerals such as selenium and the close tozero PUFA content makes them one of the best foods combined with coconut oilto consume in order to restore the saturated fats in one's body and thus increasethe health of Leydig cells.I personally add some ginger to them as well since ginger will also greatlyimprove androgen function (it can increase testosterone by up to 17.7%).15)Bone marrow and saltBone marrow is a great source of collagen, aminos, minerals, trace minerals andfat soluble vitamins.Salt will greatly support adrenals, thyroid, reduce stress and thus improvetestosterone.2.24 Lethal T nutrient combinationCombination of nutrients that have shown to increase testosterone levels by up to250%.Choline + Vitamin A + Vitamin D + Vitamin E + vitamin K2 + Zinc + VitaminB3Choline has the ability to methylate ( methylation is a process that involves theremoval of one methyl group from one substance, placing it on anothersubstance and takes place predominantly within the liver.Another important methylator besides choline is vitamin B12) to estrogenmolecules leading to a change in the shape of said molecules and thus theycannot bind well to its dedicated receptors in the body and can be excreted out ofthe body.3 free range eggs a day and your weekly beef liver will cover your choline needs.Vitamin A has been found in many studies to help suppress estrogen productionin the male testes and rats with a greater concentration of Vitamin A in the testeswere found to have increased base testosterone secretion.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 331
content: Not only that but when rats were given diets deficient in Vitamin A, theirtestosterone levels not only decreased but their testicles began to atrophy andthe inner layer of the testicles was lost.In human studies, vitamin A has been found equally effective to theadministration of testosterone on teenagers with delayed pubertal onset.Today, most people do not consume nearly enough dietary vitamin A (vitamin Dand beta carotene which are needed for the proper use of vitamin A)Vitamin A should never be supplemented and only consumed through foods suchas organ meats (with a sulfur rich food such as onions or garlic in order toprevent the over absorption of iron), raw milk and free range eggs.I personally prefer and have seen the most success in clients when theyconsume free range eggs 4 times a week, organ meats 2-3 times a week for nomore than 150 grams at a time and raw milk even every day.Vitamin D is a key vitamin related to the production and increase of testosteronebut also in the proper utilization of vitamin A.A deficiency in vitamin D causes many problems, from low testosterone, anxiety,depression, vision problems, ED, hair loss, thyroid problems (big one) and so on.The testicles also contain receptors for Vitamin D.Vitamin D directly affects the amount of total but also free testosterone in ourblood.Our bodies naturally produce vitamin D when we expose our skin to the sun andwe should favor sunlight for vitamin D over supplements.But if you live in the northern hemisphere and sunlight levels are low in the wintermonths, you can supplement a liquid vitamin D supplement with liquid vitamin K2as long as you keep vitamin A rich foods in your diet.Vitamin E affects testicular and hormonal health, but also as we said helps uscombat the oxidative damage that PUFAs have caused and helps the body fromⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 332
content: receiving this oxidative damage and releasing cortisol as a response which willsuppress testosterone.Vitamin E is also a “progesterone-sparing agent”, reduces histamine, inhibits theoxygen in the blood, is an estrogen antagonist, an aromatase inhibitor, increasesfree testosterone but it also protects the precious vitamin A from oxidation .The best sources of vitamin E are EVOO and palm kernel oil.When it comes to vitamin K2, in a rat study, it was concluded that the MK-4 formof Vitamin K2 affected the testes ability to produce testosterone by up to 70% andan almost 90% increase in the testosterone levels in their testes.It is not uncommon that when people start adding vitamin K2 rich foods in theirdiets their libido skyrockets and their sperm count increases (the same implied forevery other of the mentioned nutrients).Zinc helps the pituitary gland to produce the testosterone precursor ‘LH’ amongother things, it is required in hundreds of enzymatic reactions in the body thathelp it break down food and other nutrients and is critical for the production ofantioxidants.A study found that when zinc deficient men supplemented zinc, their testosteronelevels almost doubled over 6 months.A zinc deficiency can lead to a 30% drop in testosterone in just 16 weeks.Zinc can also reduce estrogen and SHBG levels.Don’t supplement with zinc since it always leads to some kind of zinc:copperimbalance and also most zinc supplements are toxic.Your ideal strategy for covering your zinc needs and balancing your zinc:copperratio would be a lunch with beef liver and a dinner with oysters or the reverse.Now, we mentioned the importance of vitamin B3 in lesson 1.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 333
content: Testosterone wise, vitamin B3 has been found as one of the most effective waysto treat age related steroid deficiency.Secret testosterone nutrient : Vitamin CVitamin C protects the Leydig cells in the testes from oxidative stressors,up-regulates enzyme activity in them and can even regenerate damagedtestosterone molecules! Vitamin C will increase sperm count, protect the thyroid,reduce cortisol and improve sleep quality.The testosterone meal plan that will be presented to you pays special attention tothese key nutrients you just saw.I have used this nutrient combination in many clients in order to increase theirtestosterone levels from the mid 300s all the way to even 700s which makes itmore effective than conventional TRT.Two key nutrients for free testosterone1) MagnesiumMagnesium lowers the levels of unbound SHBG in the body, by binding to itleading to more free Testosterone in the body by levels up to 40% in somestudies. In these studies a daily dose of 10mg of magnesium per kg was used.It is better to break your daily dose into smaller multiple doses and consumethroughout the day (most studies have demonstrated this) than to consume onesingle dose every day.Magnesium will also greatly protect you against nnEMF.Magnesium needs vitamin D and B6 in order to be more bioavailable so makesure besides getting sunlight in to consume your beef liver and on the days youdon’t, some prunes or sardines.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 334
content: 2) BoronBoron can both boost free testosterone and block excess estrogen in the bodyfrom being used.In several studies, 10mg of boron was given to men each day for 7 days whichled to an increase of free testosterone levels by 28.3%, decreasing estrogenlevels by 39% and significantly decreasing SHBG levels as well.Boron will also help the homeostasis of minerals as well.If you supplement with boron, 6-9mg per is enough.Chamomile nationalism?From a scientific standpoint, chamomile is great for your testosterone.It contains apigenin which helps deliver cholesterol to the mitochondria in thetestes and without sufficient amounts of apigenin, your testes can not produceenough testosterone but it also contains chrysin which helps to block the enzymearomatase.But unfortunately regular chamomile tea is not enough in order to producenoticeable effects testosterone wise (obviously though, it is not useless).If you are going to use chamomile in order to specifically optimize testosterone,you will either need to use big amounts or use a concentrated formula and maketea out of it.The same thing applies for other herbs such as passion flower which also containchrysin. ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

content: Then, they have enough cholesterol which is the building block of testosterone.We also did not skip on the carbs which will have pro thyroid and anti stresseffects (and insulin is also a great way to lower SHBG).The protein is relatively high which will lead to increased free testosterone andlower SHBG.We have balanced the aminos properly from the sea food, bone marrow andbone broth.We have included pomegranate, cacao, ginger, palm kernel oil, EVOO, coconutoil, onions, garlic and many of the foods proven to boost T but also things suchas sperm count which are declining rapidly.The oysters and seafood will increase LH and FSH.It has more than enough vitamin A in it so aromatase will be low (when there is avitamin A deficiency, aromatase activity goes through the roof).And we have more anti-estrogenic compounds such as vitamin K2 and vitamin E.Last but not least, the copper: iron ratio is optimal so estrogen will not go onoverdrive through an iron excess.Now, obviously the things we saw in the previous part of the course such asmitochondrial health, optimizing sleep, healing your metabolism and thyroid,detoxing from PUFAs, xenoestrogens and heavy metals will all play a veryimportant role in testosterone optimization.Other tips that will help you optimize testosterone are to have the proper body fatpercent, this is9-15% bf for men and 13-20%bf forwomen.Maintaining a healthy body fat percentage is also a thing to keep in mind foranyone who wants to have healthy testosterone levels.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 338
content: After a certain point, as the fat increases, there is an increase in activity of theenzyme aromatase which converts testosterone in the fat cells to estrogen.This reduces testosterone and increases estrogen, which can increase fatdeposition in typical female areas (breast, hips, thighs) and increase the risk ofenlargement of the prostate and even prostate cancer.If you are more than 20 pounds overweight, you likely have high estrogen,skewed leptin levels, lowered testosterone and are insulin resistant.If you are over 20% bf (for men) as many men are today, with every one pointdrop in your body mass index (BMI) your testosterone level can increase by even50 points.So the fat loss manifesto could be very useful to boost testosterone in the caseyou are struggling with excessive fat. title: Page 339
content: 2.26 High T moodMotivation in today’s society is overrated and biology underrated. The bodyinfluences the mind more than many people would like to admit.So in this part we will see how you can optimize your mood through biology.First of all, without proper functioning testosterone levels the dysfunction ofglucocorticoid hormones will inevitably lead to stress and anxiety as well as thedecrease in alpha brain waves without even mentioning the fact that lowtestosterone leads to a wild serotonin excess and thus low dopamine, GABA anddepression. Then you have to tackleexcessive serotonin.Most myths around serotonin are busted so far and people realize now that’sactually a stress hormone and a very powerful one.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 340
content: A serotonin excess will lead to generalized anxiety, learned helplessness, overanalytical personality (stress sourced), phobias and great dopamine and GABAimbalances in general.First of all, try ginkgo biloba (50:1) which has opposite effects of serotonin (itincreases blood flow to the brain (serotonin reduces it)) and can normalizeelevated catecholamine.Then get on bone broth since most people have mega dosed on tryptophan fromall the muscle meats which is a serotonin agonist and glycine will mitigate theexcessive tryptophan and aid in serotonin clearance.Have the Ray P inspired salad 3-6 times a week.The salad is made up of: chopped carrots, ACV, ginger, 25-50 grams of beefliver, blackseed oil, coconut oil and sea salt.The fibers in raw carrots will bind to excessive estrogen, the ginger will lowerserotonin receptivity in the gut and the blackseed oil since it can lower serotoninuptake from the gut.Then, do not fast and have eggs for breakfast for at least 4 weeks if you aresuffering from mood issues.Do not fast.If you fast, adrenaline will go on overdrive unless you are living in a cabin or havea very very low stress life.Then since adrenaline is made from dopamine, this will create a dopaminedeficiency and lead to a serotonin excess.We added the eggs since choline will increase dopamine receptor densities.Note: a promoter of adrenaline excess is zinc deficiency, so never forget to eatyour weekly serving of oysters.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 341
content: What is also cool, is that many people have reported their perfectionism wentaway after they addressed excessive serotonin.If you struggle with over analytical thought patterns, give the above cheet sheet ago(*) for 4 weeks and see if your thought process improves(*)Besides getting on B1,B2, getting plenty of B12 and choline which can also bea common cause for this. Way more common than some short of psychologicalissue.Another example of this (how high serotonin can lead to over analytical thoughtpatterns) is when people who start “fasting” with black coffee, report that they aremore “sharp”. This might be the case if you were eating twinkies for breakfast, butit is generally a lie and a very harmful one.You are not more “sharp”. Your mental patterns are on overdrive due to a rise incortisol and adrenaline.When you fast like this, you think more. Your thought process though did notbecome more effective which is the entire point.A breakfast made out of eggs cooked in some coconut oil, fruit and yerba mate incase your liver is fine and can handle some caffeine, is undefeated for realmental performance.But let’s get back to the main topic.You should obviously also learn how to properly identify and detox fromxenoestrogens as you saw in the previous part.A minimum of 2 hours of natural light should be implemented in your daily routinesince without it dopamine will once again decrease and you will face moodissues.It doesn't matter if it is a sunny day. Spend a minimum of 2 hours outside everyday.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 342
content: Optimize GABA as you saw in the previous part.Vitamin C can also help due to its natural progesterone enhancing effects.Other things that can negatively affect your mood as a man are aromatase,SHBG and prolactin.So make sure to add some dietary aromatase inhibitors such as palm kernel oil,EVOO, citrus fruits (pomegranate and grapefruit juice with no pulp), chamomile,coconut and mushrooms.You should obviously not skip on vitamin K2 rich foods since the brain is one ofthe organs containing the highest concentration of K2 and protects neurons fromoxidative stress.A choline deficiency is linked with many neurodegenerative diseases so havingegg yolks and organ meats will also be crucial to optimize your mood.Keep the protein relatively high since it provides the building blocks forneurotransmitters.And obviously also make sure to address blue light as you saw in the previouspart since it greatly lowers dopamine, and social media is known to destroydopamine sensitivity.Prolactin is a dopamine antagonist and vitamin B6 is a great prolactin antagonist.So make sure to consume enough vitamin B6 as well (which is also crucial foroverall androgen health).A men's health mood improvement stack that i've given many times, includes:-Taurine-Ginkgo-Vitamin C-Magnesium glycinateⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 343
content: -Boron-Liquid vitamin D and K2-Mucuna-Brewer's yeastThese are obviously too much in most cases, but i'm just mentioning them.2.27 Bedroom destroyer: how to cure ED and PENote: addressing the overall health of the individual (especially thyroidperformance and androgen health) is the first step for fixing these 2 issues beforeyou move on to more specific strategies.You might not even need the specific strategies at all if you optimize these(thyroid and androgens).That is the case in both ED and PE.In Erectile Dysfunction (ED) for example, if someone is not a porn viewer, most ofthe time the issue is related to suboptimal androgens, elevated stress hormones,low blood volume and also a harmed NAD+ pathway.All of which are steps in optimizing thyroid performance.But let’s see more specific strategies now.Let’s start with ED.Excessive sympathetic activity causes vasoconstriction through adrenaline andthus blocks erectile function.So the first ways to combat this is through lowering oxidative stress, serotonin,optimizing GABA and dopamine and also ginkgo biloba or niacin supplementation(do not combine the two).Do not, I repeat, do not supplement any nitric oxide products.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 344
content: You want to naturally restore a healthy nitric oxide production and not artificially.Focus on natural things that can stimulate the synthesis of nitric oxide such as afunctioning NAD+ pathway (see previous part), garlic, onions, vitamin C since itfacilitates the enzymes which synthesize endothelial nitric oxide, lower aromataseactivity (you might have to lose body fat if you are a male above 15% bf),prolactin and SHBG with strong chamomile tea even and raw dairy with addedhoney, plenty of sunlight during the day and also perhaps, boron.Obviously, without a proper functioning glucose metabolism nitric oxide can beproperly produced as well.Not only that but since insulin resistance will lead to nerve damage it willinevitably lead to erectile dysfunction.If you experience ED, you must obviously eliminate alcohol, phytoestrogens,PUFAs, gluten, food additives, artificial sweeteners, too much caffeine, workingout like a maniac, stop fasting for 23 hours a day, staying up late, not performingany cardio and skipping legs, detox from unbound iron and xenoestrogens.You should then increase the saturated fats, bioavailable calcium and enoughcalcium regulators such as magnesium, K2, D and even B12 (not directly acalcium regulator but people with gut issues (especially an ammonia excess)need it in order to properly absorb the calcium).Royal jelly is also a great tool for ED since it will support the conversion fromDHEA to testosterone. But it should be taken with breakfast in order to maximizeits effects.Another important molecule for erection is carbon dioxide which is partlyresponsible for arousal by the relaxation of the blood vessels.In case you’re experiencing ED then, thiamine (B1) supplementation with a mealthat includes fructose (fruit), protein and some fats, will be very beneficial but itcan take up to 2 weeks to notice any real effects.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 345
content: Other common causes of ED are:-A deficiency in fat soluble vitamins (especially K2 and A)-Boron deficiency-Not optimal zinc:copper ratio or even a zinc deficiency (especially in people withcompromised guts)-Heavy metal toxicity (mainly unbound iron and aluminum)-Mineral imbalances-Candida-Glyphosate (get rid of most grains and sprouted ones)-Not enough sulfur and cholesterol-High oxalates in the diet (this is why beet juice is a double edge sword and oneshould not start there) and last but not least, megadosing on lysine.-Selenium deficiencyExcessive lysine (not balanced properly with other aminos) will put nitric oxideproduction to sleep and inevitably lead to ED besides skyrocketing the productionof adrenaline.Lysine also competes with arginine and causes an endless list of arousalproblems.You do not have to worry about this though, if you stick to the balanced aminoprofile that you saw in this course.So here’s your priority list when it comes to ED.Number 1: Improve your thyroid performance and address unbound iron whichcan increase estrogen especially in androgenic tissues that are crucial forarousal.Number 2: Optimize NAD+ pathways and CO2Number 3: Lower excess serotonin through endotoxin clearance (if your gut isfine, then organic oat bran with some coconut oil, cacao, raw honey and somereishi mushroom once in a while (once every 10 days), can be a very effectivetool for this) and optimize GABA.Number 4: Optimize gut health and pay special attention to the SIBO tips.Number 5: Get plenty of vitamin D (if you get plenty of sunlight and still yourⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 346
content: vitamin D levels are low, check the pectin part on lesson 1 (sleep, calcium andvitamin D), vitamin C, E, acetylcholine and fat soluble vitamins.Number 6: Optimize androgens and if you are above 15%bf lose some fat.Number 7: Increase dopamine.Number 8: Supplements that work for ED1)Taurine (dopamine & GABA support)2)Magnesium (androgen & GABA support)3)Niacinamide (everything)4)Brewer’s yeast + some extra thiamine (CO2)5)Ginkgo biloba (pro dopamine, serotonin antagonist)6)Mucuna pruriens (pro dopamine, LH and a serotonin & prolactin antagonist)7)Tongkat Ali (short term and do not start here) (aromatase inhibitor, supportsfree testosterone, PDE-5 inhibitor).*Most maca products are polluted with even heavy metals and it is best to beavoided*Important note: Prolactin is greatly governed by the thyroid and if you findyourself lethargic even 3-4 hours after sex, this is one of the most common signsof high prolactin caused by suboptimal thyroid performance.Now let’s move on to PE.We need to break down people who experience PE into two groups.First, we have people who experience PEandhave anoveractive sex drive.This, unless again someone’s watching porn or scrolls through IG thots, is usuallycaused by a chronic excess of nitric oxide.Chronic excess of nitric oxide is not something that you want since it signals thatthe person is experiencing stress(*) for a long time.(*)Nitric oxide mediates stress hormones when in excess by delivering oxygenand inactivates respiratory enzymes in mitochondria.Now, nitric oxide does not actually give a fuck about you having a high sex drivein this case. It is a side effect and not its goal.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 347
content: It is not uncommon that people who face the most intense anxiety problems arealso the people with the higher libidos.And now you understand the underlying cause of this.The people who experience this, want to have sex just to get rid of the discomfortthat excess nitric oxide is causing them.This is the sole goal and not normal.*The same is true for women with an overactive sex drive as we see nowadays*The intense sex drive most people experience today is a sign of stress, nothealth.Again, there is a reason (aka stress hormones) why most people in the healthindustry who struggle with PE are carnivores.What you must do then if you struggle with PE, is first of all, stabilize your bloodsugar levels and this is one of the very few scenarios that a low glycemic indexdiet (but not for dinner on which you will need at least 50-75 grams of carbs if youwant to get decent sleep), can be useful forsomepeoplewho also do not haveaccess to much sunlightsince you can’t afford theexcess cortisol andadrenaline that blood sugar swings will cause but also, the amount of carbs youcan metabolize is directly affected by your light environment.Then there are two key nutrients that will greatly help you fix PE.Taurine and acetylcholine.Taurine will increase both dopamine and GABA (which is anti erectile/ejaculatorywhich is what you want in this case).Premature ejaculation a lot of times is a sign ofnon optimized GABA, highprolactin and low dopamine so taurine will greatly help with all these.Then, acetylcholine is an important neurotransmitter for the parasympatheticnervous system which is made from choline and B vitamins (especially B1) andpromotes dopamine production.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 348
content: Melatonin also directly increases the release of acetylcholine so focus on theentire part in lesson 1 about fixing sleep.Another tip that will greatly help you is learning to breathe during intercorse.Just as when working with individuals that are interested in performance, wehave doubled their endurance and even almost their strength, by teaching themhow to properly breathe when lifting, so can you increase your endurance in bedby learning to breathe deeply during it.Remember that carbon dioxide is partly responsible for arousal and orgasm.By holding your breath and not breathing deeply, you naturally increase the levelsof carbon dioxide in your body and thus you will last less in bed.Now this is tricky. You need a healthy endogenous production of CO2 becausewithout it nitric oxide will be overproduced and harm your metabolic health, butyou do not need to raise CO2 through the breath.It is unnecessary and it will only cause you to not last longer.If you need to use your breath in order to get aroused, you should focus onimproving metabolic health.Last but not least, a common underdiagnosed cause for PE is prostatitis(inflammation of the prostate) which increases its sensitivity to contraction andthus resulting in PE.If that’s the case, then one must cut out grains, inferior fats, dairy for a while (yes,even raw dairy), address possible bacterial overgrowth as you saw in the gut partespecially with a natural antibiotic since bacteria can invade inflamed anddamaged tissue and prevent their healing and bacterial infection could be by itselfa cause of PE. ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 349
content: 2.28 Boosting fertilityInfertility is an extremely complicated and to be honest sad subject.I am not saying that this protocol will help you become fertile, but it will helpyou out.Here’s a list of things that both sexes will benefit from:- Consuming 100 grams of oysters twice a week.- Consuming 100grams of beef liver twice a week since vitamin A plays acritical role in fertility.-250-500mg of vitamin C the days they are trying to conceive.- Vitamin K (both K2 and K1) if one’s diet is not sufficient.- Sunlight and/or vitamin D3+K2.- Trying to eliminate EMF as much as possible.- CoQ10 (beef heart).- Folic acid (from whole foods).- Biweekly sardines.- Lowering stress and improving thyroid.- Wear underwear only made out of cotton. Synthetic fibers do more harm toyour reproductive organs than you might think.- Any form of magnesium.- Quality vitamin E (vitamin E, vitamin A and progesterone are the only thingsproven to be able to actually restore fertility).ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 350
content: After that, there is one supplement that has been proven to have profoundeffects on fertility for men and that is Acetyl L carnitine and for womenprogesterone (obviously be careful with it and consult your doctor).Then for men, zinc will be crucial since it protects seminal fluid from oxidation,which means it also protects the testes from oxidation and thus can stronglyimprove sperm health and ejaculate quality, force, and volume.And glutathione that does the exact same thing.Reducing stress hormones and estrogen is crucial as well especially for womensince elevated estrogen can even kill the baby in the womb.A critical part of this will be of course copper and addressing unbound iron as wesaw in lesson 1.Obviously do not over correct and consume 2 pounds of organ meats per week.No, instead focus on 20-30 weeks of implementing what we discussed beforetrying to make a baby.In order to be fertile and give birth to a healthy baby, you want to be experiencingas little stress as possible.Nowcistanche is shown to improve fertility on a geneticlevel (it was able torestore Kisspeptin 1 ( a family of peptide hormones, which play a critical role inreproduction).Optimizing the Leydig cell health as you saw in this lesson will be crucial as well.A thing that can quite dramatically increase sperm count is shilajit and ginger.Shilajit can increase sperm count by even up to 60% and ginger by even up to16.2%.Vitamin E is also extremely important since vitamin E deficient men bothexperience a significant drop in LH, FSH, and testosterone levels.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 351
content: In some studies they were even able to restore the fertility of infertile rats byvitamin E.Also make sure to get rid of excess serotonin since it destroys sperm count.As you are starting to understand at this point, there are a few pillars of healththat affect everything but in different ways and our goal is to teach people: a)howto optimize these pillars and b)how they affect different parts of one’s physiologyin order not to make the wrong assumptions.After this, it is very possible for the individual to reach and maintain peak levels ofhealth throughout their lifetime if they understand what harms health and whatpromotes it.These 2 lessons you just read are these pillars and when optimized, i have seenthem getting rid of health issues that were even considered impossible. ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 353
content: 3.1 How to add muscle (Page 3)3.2 How to get effortlessly get lean (Page 69)3.3 Recomposition split (pages 97-103)3.4 Master bodyweight training (pages 104-140)3.5 Women’s training (Page 141)3.6 How to stay in shape when extremely busy(Page 173)3.7 How to train in order to optimize testosterone(Page 200)3.8 How to train in order to fix your posture (Page 209) ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 354
content: 3.1 How to add muscleLet’s start with the common pitfalls of building muscle.Building muscle requires a positive energy balance, which means that you musttake in more calories than you burn.BUT, your body can build at most around 227g of muscle each week.Which leads us to common pitfall #1 : “Bulking”Bulking in the classical sense (a 500+cal surplus) can be effective for guys thatare either new to the gym or extremely underweighted guys.Your average gym bro that is unfamiliar with health twitter will get insulinresistance sooner or later by eating 6 carb meals a day , avoiding the sun , notdoing cardio and never consuming salmon or ghee since they are “high fat”.This is why “bulking” should be avoided in most cases.What you should focus on instead if you are not a beginner, is for an average 2-3pound weight gain per month after you’ve got your diet on point.Which leads us to common pitfall #2 : inflated expectations.The average 18 year old has more inflated expectations than the inflation of thedollar when it comes to the results he can get as a natty.The best advice i can give to these people is that they can achieve a decentfizeek if they put in the work for at least 5 years and should stop undervaluingwhat they accomplish because they compare themselves to the wrong people.Common pitfall #3 : inconsistencyYou can destroy something you were building all week in one day.It’s very common for people to be disciplined all week and then blow it all off onthe weekend.Two days of partying for example, will destroy 80% of your progress you made inthe gym all week.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 355
content: Sure, go out , meet women, have fun and so on.But do you honestly need to drink 1 bottle of tequila and eat worse than youraverage normie?You’re throwing away all of your hard work.Pitfall #4: Training too muchAs a natural lifter in order to build muscle , you need to be getting stronger.All the pump work in the world will not save you if you bench 100 pounds.The problem with natties in today’s era is too much isolation work for the smallmuscle groups.For example.Let’s just say you just did a 5x5 bench , if you now continue your workout with 10sets of isolation work for triceps you won’t be getting stronger since your tricepsand tendons can not handle all this volume.So limit the amount of accessory work you’re doing for small muscle groups andstick to the programs i’m about to give you.Your number will go up and you will gain more muscle as a side effect of that.Pitfall #5 : Not enough rest.Most natties that don’t sit all day can recover anywhere from 2-5 hours ofresistance training per week (warm ups not included).If you train more than that , chances are you won’t recover and make the gainsyou can or you will sacrifice your hormonal health for a tiny boost in aesthetics.Last but not least , if you’re not sleeping properly you are not recovering properly.With the proper nutrients in your system , as you sleep , your body will get in anenhanced anabolic state.Every important hormone is produced when you sleep. So implement what youread in lesson 1 when it comes to sleep.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 356
content: The main formula for building muscle is: resistance training + sleep +protein + nutrients + unopposed testosterone.So let’s see the diet that you will be following now.If you skipped the body type part, you can either go back to it or perform themetabolic type self test.I do not believe in approaching everyone’s macro (and micro) splits the samewhen it comes to optimal performance.After performing the test, you will be in one of these 3 categories.#1 Protein Type Macro split: 40% protein, 30-40% fat, 20-30% carbohydrates#2 Mixed Type Macro split: 33% protein, 33% fat, 33% carbohydrates.#3 Carb Type Macro split: 25-30% protein, 20-30% fat, 40-55% carbohydrates.No matter which one of these 3 you’re in, here’s what should be your proteinsources, your fat sources and your carbohydrate sources.Acceptable fat sources list:-Coconut oil (both raw and for cooking).-Free range egg yolks (if you can not get free range/organic eggs do notconsume the yolk, they have started feeding the chicken dyes the last years andthe yolks will obviously be very high in PUFAs).-EVOO (only raw, not for cooking).-Raw dairy after addressing SIBO and candida.-The fat of any kind of quality meat (except pork).-Grass fed butter and ghee.-Tallow.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 357
content: -Sardines.-Avocados.-Olives.Acceptable protein sources list:-Free range eggs-Organic egg protein powder (way cheaper and cleaner than you might think)-Beef-Oysters-Mussels-Shrimp-Cod-White fish-Sardines-Raw dairy-Some chicken-Lamb-Some turkey (once a month for example)-Quality/Coming from a small farm organ meatsAcceptable carb sources list:-Any type of berry-CherriesⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 358
content: -Peaches-Apricots-Pineapple-Mangos-Pomegranate juice with no pulp-Kiwis-Grapefruit juice (no pulp)-Oranges juice (no pulp)-Any kind of local and seasonal fruit-Raw/local honey-Raw dairy-Potatoes-Sweet potatoes-Sprouted bone broth white rice-Sprouted spelt bread occasionally (once every 2-3 weeks)So basically your grocery list should only include things from the above listsLet’s also briefly mention what you shouldn’t eat if you want to gain musclein order not to mess with your metabolic and hormonal health.-Seed oils/ high PUFA foods.-Gluten ( even some of the sourdough proponents don’t realize sometimes thatwe’re not meant to consume braid everyday. We are meant to take break from itfrom time to time)ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

content: -Anything that comes in a package. (Food is not supposed to come in apackage).-Uncooked vegetables (except carrots, cabbage sometimes and cucumbers) orveggies that are not cooked in animal fats.-Cheap dairy.-Booze.-Low quality coffee/Black coffee.-Corn.-Soy.-Processed meats.-Food additives.-Artificial sweeteners (They disrupt your endocrine system more than plastic a lotof times)What should we eat then? Well this depends on your metabolic type results.Here are a few examples for each metabolic type.Recommended meals for the protein typeMeal 1Ingredients: 4 free range eggs, 2 teaspoons of coconut oil ,1-2 optionalslices of swiss cheese, 2 slices of homemade sprouted spelt bread or 5-6non seed oil and sugar filled normal size rice cakes, 2 thin slices of tomato,sea salt, smoked paprika, 2 handfuls of mixed berries or cherries.Step 1: Grab a skillet.Step 2: Medium heat.Step 3: Throw the coconut oil in.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

Have the fruit on the side.These meals are macro and micronutrient balanced.Feel free to add more of the stuff that you read about in the previous lessons, butthis is an example of a simple and effective meal plan for each metabolic type.Now, please also implement the principles of lesson 1 as well since you can notadd muscle with suboptimal metabolic health.Now here’s a bunch of splits that i have used effectively in clients over the yearsdepending on their lifting experience.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 368
content: BUT,before we do this, here’s a routine you can use every day to prevent injuriesand move better.You are going to perform the following exercises/stretches in acyclical manner for 3-4 sets in total.-Hanging from a pull up bar by using a narrow grip (this isimportant) for around 10-15 seconds before your forearms give up.-Child pose hold for 20 seconds. -Elevated single leg glute bridge for 6-8 (no need to over do it) repson each leg (make sure to squeeze on top). Obviously, don’t be lazyand engage your core. -Hold the deep squat position for 20 seconds.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 369
content: -8-10 reps of the superman hyperextension (on the floor). (You willnot perform this exercise every day but 5/7) -Knee to the opposite shoulder (glute stretch) hold for 15-25seconds on each leg. ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 370
content: -Kneeling lunge hip stretch hold for 15-20 seconds on each leg. -Upper trap stretch on a chair hold for 10-15 seconds on each side. ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 371
content: -Performevery other daythe wall hamstring stretch.Hold for 15seconds on each leg. Note: When you stretch, you should never feel pain but only a slightstretch. I had clients that snapped their hamstring from stretching.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 372
content: Last note:The goal of this whole program is to add weight or reps in eachof the mentioned exercises. These are the exercises that will build a greatphysique.Most people at the gym operate either at 50% (undertraining) or at 200%(over training). You need to push yourself up to 90% of your potential. Thisis what will allow you to gain muscle while minimizing your chances ofinjury.Now let’s move on to the mass splits. Split number 1 (Level: Intermediate)(You can follow this split for up to 4-5 months , if you want to keep addingmuscle after these months , you should switch to split #2)Upper 1 / Lower 1 / Rest / Upper 2 / Lower 2 /Rest / Rest / RepeatUpper 1Warm up3setsx8-12 reps of front pull aparts (with a band)3setsx12-15 reps of internal rotations (with a band)3 sets 8-12reps of external rotations (with a band)3setsx12-15reps of TRX face pulls (or band face pulls)3setsx8reps of wall angles(Rest 30 seconds-1 minute between exercises)Exercise 1ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 373
content: Chest dips1st set : ⅓-¼ of your max reps2nd set: ⅓ of your max reps3rd set: ½ of your max reps4th set: ⅔ of your max reps5th set : ⅔ of your max repsRest 3-5 minutes between sets and hang from a pull up bar anywhere from15-30seconds between setsRest 1 minute and move on to the next exerciseExercise 2Pull ups ( if you can’t do pull ups , do assisted pull ups (with a band))1st set : ⅓ of your max reps2nd set: ½ of your max reps3rd set: ½ of your max reps4th set: 2 reps before failure5th set : 2 reps before failureRest 3 minutes between setsRest 1 minute and move on to the next exerciseExercise 3American swings1st set : 12 reps2nd set: 10-12 reps3rd set: 10-12 repsRest 2 minutes between setsRest 1 minute and move on to the next exerciseExercise 4Close grip bench press1st set : 15 repsⒸHelios_Movement LLC
