title: Page 420
content: Rest 1-2 minutes between setsDay 6:Rest and perform the planks for 3 sets of 30seconds as you didbefore on rest days.Day 7:Rest3.2 How to lose fat and keep it off once and for all withoutharming your metabolic health.If you want to lose fat, chances are that you have already tried a few times withsome success and some others with not so much.I promise you this though, if you take 1 week to read this, internalize the conceptsthat are presented here and prepare the way that is presented here, you willexperience positive results.That’s the first thing. Before you start your fat loss journey, take a few days toprepare for it. If you don’t, you will fail.Now even though i cringe talking online about such things, here are a fewcommon reasons why most people fail with fat loss that i have seen over andover and over.#1 They have too many goals at once.This 10/10 times results in someone being overworked while achieving nothing.Aka being more busy without accomplishing anything extra.A lot of people underestimate how hard accomplishing worthwhile things actuallyis and think that they can do a zillion different things all at once.You can’t. No one can.Worthwhile pursuits take almost all of our effort and time in order to beaccomplished.So, if you want to lose fat, fat loss should be one of your top (if not the top)priorities.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 421
content: You have to sit down and tell yourself “okay, for the next 60-90 days, i will focusprimarily on this if i want to accomplish it”.#2 Not taking ownership.During the fat loss process you will fuck up.If you don’t fuck up, you’re not trying hard enough (if you fuck up all the time youare trying too hard though which is also counterproductive).So when you fuck up, accept that it is normal.Don’t take part in the blame game and just get back on track.Ownership is not a “blame game”.This is a common misconception.Owing your problem is basically asking yourself what can I do in order to not fuckup anymore.It’s not this weird “it’s my fault/i’m a piece of shit” mental game that’s been goingon in a lot of circles which will get you more in trouble through shame.Owning your mistakes is saying “i fucked up”, it’s not saying “i’m a fuck up”.Big difference.#3 Not adding new healthy habits.A lot of people quit their bad habits but they do not replace them with better onesso they’re left with nothing.What happens then, is that since you want to feel anything except boredom, yourmind will trick you into believing that things will be different this time if you indulgein your ex bad habits because you need some dopamine hits.So, in order not to relapse you need to find new healthy dopamine sources suchas achieving goals (achieving personal highs is a high like nothing else), workingon your vision etc.Fat loss requires a lifestyle change. Don’t forget that.The thing with lifestyle changes though, is that they also require an identitychange.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 422
content: In order for this to happen you have to accept that you can not be your “old self”so to speak and you need to focus on conquering a better version of yourself andthis requires pain which brings us to the point of: suffering mentally during thisprocess, is normal.That’s how any type of positive psychological change happens.So, for a successful fat loss to take place, a client needs to accept thatsometimes he or she will suffer and that’s a “good” thing because it signals longterm growth.#4 Thinking that an impulse lasts forever.When you take part on a fat loss journey you will experience impulses to fuck up.What you must learn to do these times is to sit with the impulse as long as youcan.A lot of impulses don’t last long. Some of them don’t last longer than 5 minutes.Do you know how many people don’t lose fat because they can’t sit with animpulse for 10 minutes?Millions.Don’t be one of them.Let’s move on.What do you think is more important for fat loss?The way you eat or the way you train?Well the answer to this is obviously the way you eat.You can’t outlift a bad diet. It is impossible.So we can not have a successful fat loss journey without the client getting familiarwith a few specific diet concepts.Here’s your grocery list for fat lossYou will be consuming the following things in your fat loss journeyⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 423
content: -(Some) ground beef and ribeyes-Any type of organ meat coming from quality sources-(Some) potatoes-Organic rice-Marrow bones-Frozen berries-Eggs/Free range eggs-Oysters/Canned oysters-Pumpkin-Avocados-EVOO (extra virgin olive oil) or coconut oil-Grass fed butter or ghee-Any type of berry-Coconut water-Sea salt-Smoked paprikaⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 424
content: -Black pepper-Oregano-Bell peppers-Non seed oil filled rice cakes-Local honey/Raw honey-Uncured bacon-Cinnamon-Sweet potatoes-Chicken-Lamb-Shrimp-Sardines-Peaches-(Some apples that you should blend)-Watermelon-MelonⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 425
content: -Some kiwis-Single ingredient spices (most spice “mixes” have dextrose, food additives and amillion other different things).Also, please stop trying to lose weight by destroying your metabolism.Most of the conventional fat loss methods result in long term metabolicdestruction. You don’t need to eat chicken , lettuce and workout 5 hours a day.First start by doing things that arepro metabolicsuch as :- Getting your sleep in order.- Getting in the sun.- Walking 10K steps a day.- Fixing nutrient deficiencies.- Stop working too much.- Getting rid of poisons and providing the proper fuel to your body.After you’ve handled these (which will result in fat loss by themselves most of thetime), then we can talk about more fat loss stuff such as intuitive eating.So please, if you skipped everything on this course and got straight into fat loss,read lessons 1 and 2.Then we must move on to addressing deficiencies.Why?Well because without addressing them fat loss could even be impossible.Why?ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 426
content: Well if a person for example suffers from a severe B12 deficiency, he can’t loseweight. No, no, no. He/She literally can not.A severe B12 deficiency leads to a person being hungry no matter how muchfood he consumes. He literally can not feel full.The same can be true for a lot of vitamins and minerals.If for example you’re deficient in magnesium, you WILL get wild cravings after aworkout.There are 7 common deficiencies in today’s day and age.Our strategy for fixing them will be targeted supplementation for 1-2 months andthe right diet.Number 1: B vitamin deficiencyWay to fix: Beef liver with brewer's yeast, some extra B1 (thiamine) andoccasionally B3.Number 2: Glutamine and glycine deficiencyWay to fix: Bone broth (you will see the recipe) and quality bone marrow.Number 3: Magnesium deficiencyWay to fix: Magnesium glycinate.Number 4: Vitamin DWays to fix: Sunlight, pectins and perhaps a liquid form of D3 with K2.Number 5: Vitamin AⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 427
content: Ways to fix: Small doses (30grams) of organ meats every day.Can you lose body fat without tracking?Both yes and no.The answer is yes, if you have been eating super clean and you do not sufferfrom a bacterial overgrowth in your gut which results in a false signal of hungerand no if you have one.The most common gut issues you actually mess up people in their fat lossjourneys are candida and SIBO.People who suffer with both of these can actually have a pretty hard time dietingand it’s not a matter of “willpower” or “discipline”.It’s literally 3-4 times harder for them to diet. So implement what you read on thegut part.As you can tell by now, most fat loss approaches do not work because they don’taddress all of these things that we’re talking about here.If a person for example suffers from a B12 deficiency and has candida, he literallyneeds the will power of running an ultra marathon just to cut 2 pounds.I’m not kidding. I’ve seen this time after time after time with real life clients.Fat loss is not a torture, you will suffer but if you suffer 24/7 something’s off.But to get back to the question of if you can lose fat without tracking, yes you canafter you’ve fixed any deficiencies and gut issues.Calories on the labels of food were included in 1990 after all.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 428
content: There were guys shredded way before calorie labels.(Gironda even competed in the 1950s).So not counting and being lean is 100% possible.The only metrics I have used in order to reach even a 7% bf , were hunger andthe mirror.If you are never hungry during the day, you are at your maintenancecalories or a caloric surplus.If you’re hungry all day and unable to sleep , you’re either training too muchand your stress hormones have become jacked up. Or you are at a too bigof a caloric deficit.That’s all.We will obviously mention macros and calories for people who want tofollow this approach but to get lean you basically must: a) have a healthymetabolism and b) be hungry , but not too hungry.That’s it? Yeah, that’s it after you get familiar with calories, macros and haveinternalized some concepts.Truth is that if you start being health conscious, the mentality that you will gain asa result of this quest will help you be at 10-15%bf almost effortlessly throughstrategic decisions.You will not have a problem “keeping the fat off”.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 429
content: Now for the people who want to do the calorie and macro counting approach,please do it this way. Here’s some more fat loss tips.Tip 1: Clean up your diet and stick to low dopamine triggering foods.Don’t make dieting more hard than it need to be because you’re over stimulatingyour taste buds (one more reason why i’m against iifym).Consume food. Not drugs.Today’s “foods” are designed to be as addictive as possible resulting in us overeating them.No wonder why most people are “hungry” all the time.They’re not hungry, they experience withdrawals.Food is not supposed to give you heroin-like withdrawals when you don’tconsume it for only a few hours.So stick to clean foods such as the ones we mentioned.Tip 2: If you tend to overeat a certain food. Don’t eat it in “moderation”. Justdon’t eat it. Even if it's “clean”.Tip 3: Find the meals that fill you up for the least amount of calories, makesure they’re micronutrient dense and stick to them.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 430
content: Finding out the best foods you can feed yourself is a trial & error process. Acceptthis instead of trying to figure out the “perfect” recipe.The best criteria to adhere to are:-How does it digest? ( are you bloated after eating it?)-How does your energy feel after eating it? (do you become energized orlethargic)Tip 4: Do not drink too much water (crucial).Most gym bros consume way too much water.Then they piss a bunch of electrolytes, throw their blood sugar out of whack andget hungry every couple of hours.Consume water with salts and pure electrolytes.Also, consuming too much water destroys your gut acid and leads to all sorts ofbacterial problems.Tip 5: Biweekly liver.One thing that is also crucial when cutting, is making sure to consume50-100grams of beef liver twice a week since B12 greatly regulates your hunger.If you don’t have sufficient B12 levels in your system, you will always be hungry.Tip 6: If you are a beginner, calculate the macros for 20-30 meals so youknow where you’re at calorie wise.Other strategies that help and provide structure for fat loss are:Number 1: Weighing yourself daily.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 431
content: Number 2: Sticking to only 3 meals a day.Number 3: Prioritizing protein in your meals.Number 4: Do NOT overfill your plate. I can’t even describe how manyclients i had over ate simply because they were filling up their plates too much.Number 5: Not keeping junk in the house.Number 6: Always keeping snacks with you in case you get hungry.Number 7: Don’t try to cut weight too fast. Accept that it takes months.Number 8: When you fuck up (you will fuck up, you’re not a machine),don’t try to overcorrect things by consuming 500 kcals. Get back to the plan.Number 9: Accept that fat loss is a trial and error process with ups and downs. It’snot linear.Number 10: Raw carrots and sparkling water with salt are a great snack to stophunger. Just don’t over do it.Number 11: If you’re not losing weight, add 20 minutes of extra walking during theday. If this does not work cut 200 calories from carbs. Understanding insulinⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 432
content: Insulin is a hormone which is produced by our pancreas and its purpose is to helpglucose in our blood enter cells in our muscles and liver mostly.Every time we eat something our pancreas secretes insulin but the amount ofinsulin depends on a) our metabolic health and b) what we eat.Now, way more people than you think due to a variety of reasons (from lack ofsunlight exposure, PUFAs coming from inferior fat sources such as canola oil,lack of muscle mass etc), have developed something called insulin resistance.Insulin resistance is a condition in which the cells in our muscles, fat and liverdon’t respond properly to insulin and can’t take up glucose from the blood whichresults in our pancreas secreting more and more and more insulin.Why is this bad?Well because when our liver has gotten to the point that it can't utilize glucoseproperly, the metabolic damage we have is pretty severe since the beta cellshave come to the point of not being able to keep the blood glucose levels in thenormal range.We need to have optimized insulin levels not only to lose fat (if you areexperiencing insulin resistance, losing fat is very hard) but for our health ingeneral.The opposite of insulin resistance is insulin sensitivity which leads to the properabsorption and utilization of glucose.Insulin is very, VERY, inflammatory and can lead to systemic inflammation.How to optimize insulin.1) No seed oils/Low PUFA.See lesson 1 (PUFA detox)2)Resistance trainingMuscles use glucose at a phenomenal level.Muscle tissue uses the vast majority of glucose.So before things start getting complicated, lift the way that will be presented toyou.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 433
content: 3) Stick to low glycemic index carbs for 6-12 weeks and use higher indexglycemic carbs only for your post workout meal.Low glycemic index carbs (such as berries for example) are carbs that do notlead to massive insulin releases.Also timing your carb intake is important that’s why the best time to eat a higherglycemic index carb source is post lift.4) Fix B vitamin deficiency.There’s been a bro myth out there that insulin resistance springs from overconsumption of calories, well this might be true but in today’s day and age it alsosprings from malnutrition.When you consume an X amount of calories without also the proper vitamins andminerals that lead to the proper utilization of it, you will face insulin problems.If you struggle with insulin resistance, a short term B vitamin supplementation canbe phenomenal too.5) 3 weeks of ALA followed by 3 weeks of niacinamide the way it waspresented in lesson 1.DO NOT COMBINE THE TWO. EVER.Both ALA and niacinamide are phenomenal tools to help improve insulinresistance.6) Sun and sleepWe already addressed both.What about calories?In order to find your maintenance calories, multiply your weight by 15 (these arealso the calories that you must use in order to recomp) then, substarck 300-500calories out of them (start low).These are the calories that you must follow in order to properly lose fat whilemaintaining muscle and your macronutrient split should be based on themetabolic type you are.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 434
content: But all of the meals that we have mentioned in the entire course range from2.000-3.500 calories besides having enough protein and micronutrients, so if youstick to these and listen to your body, you can lose a bunch of fat.Let’s see an example of a full day of eating based on different caloric needs.Meal 11)If you follow a 2000 kcal diet plan: Throw 1 teaspoon coconut oil in a pan.Crack 2 whole eggs and 3-4 egg whites in there. Add sea salt , pepper andsmoked paprika and wait until the whites are cooked but the yolks remain raw.Put the eggs on a plate and throw in the pan as many mushrooms as you want ,wait for 1-4 minutes and then throw in some spinach. Have 2 handfuls of berrieson the side. (around 600kcal)2)If you follow a 3000 kcal meal plan: Throw 2 teaspoons coconut oil in a pan.Crack 2 whole eggs and 3-4 egg whites in there. Add sea salt , pepper andcayenne and wait until the whites are cooked but the yolks remain raw. Put theeggs on a plate and ½ an avocado next to them. Throw in the pan as manymushrooms as you want , wait for 1-4 minutes and then throw in some spinach.Have 2 handfuls of berries on the side. ( around 850 kcal)3)If you follow a 3000- 4000 kcal meal plan: Throw 2 teaspoons coconut oil in apan. Crack 3 whole eggs and 3-4 egg whites in there. Add sea salt , pepper andcayenne and wait until the whites are cooked but the yolks remain raw. Put theeggs on a plate and ½ an avocado next to them. Throw in the pan as manymushrooms as you want , wait for 1-4 minutes and then throw in some spinach.Serve with 50 gr of goat’s feta on the eggs. Have 2 handfuls of berries on the side(around 1200 kcal)Meal 21)If you follow a 2000 kcal diet plan: Take bowl and throw in 200-300gr of groundbeef cooked in 2 teaspoons of ghee or grass fed butter with sea salt, smokedpaprika, black pepper and turmeric, add 50-100 grams of asparagus, 1-2 beets,handful of olives and 1 medium size cucumber with 1 tablespoon of EVOO on topsome sea salt and lemon. Have 2 ripe bananas next to it. (around 700-900calories).2)If you follow a 3000 kcal meal plan: Take a big bowl and throw in 250-300gr ofsardines canned in EVOO only (drain the oil) olives , cucumber, ½ an avocadoⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 435
content: and 1 medium size cucumber. Drizzle everything with lemon, sea salt and 1tablespoon of EVOO. Have 2 medium sizes of pineapple next to it (around900-1100 calories).3)If you follow a 3000- 4000 kcal meal plan. Add 2 medium size baked potatoesto option 2 and you will be at 1200-1300 calories.Meal 31) If you follow a 2000 kcal diet plan: Bake 300 gr of sweet potatoes with ½teaspoon of cinnamon and 200-300 gr of chicken breast with 2 teaspoons ofcoconut oil, some sea salt and smoked paprika. (around 700 calories).2) If you follow a 3000 kcal meal plan: Again, 300 gr of baked sweet potatoeswith ½ teaspoon of cinnamon, on them next to 200-300 gr of chicken breast with2 teaspoons of coconut oil, some sea salt and smoked paprika and 1-2 pieces offruit. (around 900 calories).3) If you follow a 3000- 4000 kcal meal plan. 100-200gr of pasta or gluten freepasta next to 200-300 of baked chicken thighs with 2 teaspoons of coconut oil,some sea salt and smoked paprika, natural tomato sauce and 1-2 pieces of fruit.(around 1200-1500 calories)Now let’s move on to how you should train in order to be hungry24/7.Option AFull body #1 / Rest / Full body #2/ Rest / Rest repeatThe warm up for both days-2setsx8-12 reps of front pull aparts (with a band)-2setsx12-15 reps of internal rotations (with a band)-2sets 8-12reps of external rotations (with a band)ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 436

title: Page 455
content: Repeat3.4 How to master bodyweight training.Let’s start with a list of benefits that bodyweight training has:1)Convenience. All you need is a floor and a pull up bar in order to follow thisprogram.That makes it perfect for people that don’t have time to hit the gym or don’t evenhave access to a gym and people who travel a lot.2)It’s a better mood booster than weights since it’s low taxing in your body andnervous system which means that you can train more frequently and experiencean endorphin release more frequently as well as a consequence.3)You have less chances of an injury happening when training with your ownbodyweight.4)You will get gigantic pumps.5)Bodyweight movements are more functional than free weight movements.Functionality is something most people underestimate its importance until theyreach 40. Don’t be like most people.6)If you train in martial arts , bodyweight movements can be a perfectsupplementation to your training. Movements like dips can dramatically increaseyour striking power and speed for example.7)You need to train everything if you want to have longevity as an athlete.8)Less time consuming than going to the gym.9)You can train shirtless without getting kicked out.10)You can build great endurance.11)It’s perfect for beginners and guys that have severe injuries or have reachedplateaus in certain movements such as the bench press.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 456
content: 12)Bodyweight movements activate more core muscles than a lot of weightmovements, so you will develop a great core by default if you are performing theexercises properly.13)In order to progress in bodyweight movements you can’t be fat. You mustkeep your leaness. This does not mean that you’ll be skinny. This simply meansthat you’ll be lean.14)Bodyweight movements will increase balance, coordination and flexibility.Now , some people say that you can’t build a lot of muscle with bodyweighttraining.These people have never been to Santa Monica , seen a gymnast or they don’teven understand that closed chain movements (bodyweight movements) allowfor enhanced muscle fiber recruitment.Moving on.The most common problem bodyweight programs have is that they are notfocused in progression. They go from taking someone who can do 100 push upsand make them do 150. This is kind of useless and can even hurt tendons.It’s way way better to make him do more advanced movements instead.If you want your fizeek to get better , you must progress and get stronger.Your body will not change and build muscle unless it has a reason to.So in this program you will go through the following progressions:-Beginner movements-Intermediate movements-Advanced movementsAnother problem with bodyweight programs is that they are way way complicatedand include weird voodoo movements it’s hard to even remember.One of the reasons I love bodyweight training is that it is so minimalistic and freesup mental space as a byproduct.Before we move on you must learn to recognise and avoid the most commonmistakes when performing bodyweight movements.Avoid the most common mistakesⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 457
content: First learn how to press. We will take push ups as an example but the sameprinciples apply to any pushing movement.Most gym bros might be able to do 50 pushups in one sitting , but they can not do50 pushups with proper technique in one sitting.Since bodyweight movements don’t tax your joints as much , it is pretty easyperforming the exercises wrong without experiencing any side effects.For example if you benched pressed in a 90 degree angle your shoulders wouldget destroyed. But you can get away with doing pushups wrong for a long timebefore this happens.So common mistakes when performing a push movement are : pressing in a 90degree angle (you should find the sweet spot between 50 and 70 degrees) , notengaging your core (extremely important) and your palms looking straight aheadinstead of slightly outwards (this is the most common cause for wrist problemswhen performing push ups).Common mistakes when performing a pull movement are the thumb not goingover the bar and not maintaining a neutral head position.Common mistakes when performing leg movements are not engaging your coreand not performing them barefoot.And a common mistake when performing all of them is locking out your joints.Stop.Now let’s see what movements you’re going to perform in this program.1) Push variationsGreat exercises to build your chest , shoulders , triceps, pressing strength ingeneral and the abdominals.The push progress in this program is as follows :-Incline (40 degrees) push ups-Regular push ups-Decline (20-40 degrees) push ups-Bar dips-Dips-Pike push ups-One hand push upsⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 458
content: -Handstand push upsThe “with which one should I start” answer.If you can not perform 15 reps incline push ups you should start with them untilyou can perform 4 sets of 15 reps.If you can do 4 sets of 15 reps of incline pushups, move on to regular push upsafter warming up with 1-2 sets of incline ones.If you can perform 25+ reps of incline push ups , start with regular push ups fromthe get go.If you can perform 4 sets of 15 reps of regular push ups, move on to decline pushups after warming up with 2 sets of regular ones and you’ll start throwing in thereregular dips and bar dips as well.Always make sure to warm up with regular push ups before jumping to declineones.If you can perform 4 sets of 15 reps of decline push ups, move on to pikepushups after you’ve warmed up with regular and decline pushups for 1-2 setseach.After you’ve managed to progress to the point you’re able to perform 4 sets of10-12 reps of pike push ups your fizeek will look great and you’ll need to mastersome of the core movements in order to progress to the last stage of one handpush ups and handstand push ups.2) Pull variationsGreat exercises to build your back , biceps, grip strength in general and critical inorder to develop that aesthetic V taper.The pull progress in this program is as follows :-Assisted chin ups/Assisted neutral grip pull ups/Dip bar rows (treat them as thesame exercise in this phase)-Assisted pull ups-Chin ups-Pull ups-One arm assisted (with a towel) chin ups-One arm assisted (with a towel) pull ups-One arm chin upsⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 459
content: -One arm pull upsThe “with which one should I start” answer.If you can not perform 8 reps of assisted chin ups you should start with them untilyou can perform 4 sets of 6 reps.If you can do 4 sets of 6 reps of assisted chin ups, move on to assisted pull ups.If you can perform 15 reps of assisted pull ups , move on to chin ups until youcan perform 4 sets of 8 reps.If you can perform 4 sets of 8 reps of chin ups, move on to pull ups until you canperform 4 sets of 8-12.If you can perform 4 sets of 8-12 reps of pull ups move on to one arm assistedchin ups and pull ups until you can perform 2 sets of 6 reps for both of them.Then you will be able to do one arm chin ups if you lock down the technique.3) Squat variations (Leg movements)Great exercises to build your legs and core.The squat progress in this program is as follows :-Calf raises ( i assume you can do calf raises so i will not mention them)-Regular squats-Single leg glute bridges-90 degree/chair pistol squats-Pistol squats-Nordic curlsThe “with which one should I start” answer.If you can not perform 15 reps of regular squats you should start with them untilyou can perform 4 sets of 15 reps.If you can do 4 sets of 15 reps of regular squats, move on to single leg glutebridges until you can perform 3 sets of 8 reps for each leg and then move on to90 degree pistol squats warming up with 2 sets of regular ones.If you can perform 4 sets of 6 reps of 90 degree pistol squats, move on to pistolsquats after warming up with 2-4 sets of regular ones and 1 set of 90 degreeones.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 460
content: 4) Core movementsThe core movement progress in this program is as follows :-Crunches/Hyperextensions-Planks-Reverse planks/Knee raises/Side planks-Leg raises-Toes to bar-L sits / Back bridgesThe “with which one should I start” answer.If you can not perform 15 reps of crunches and hyperextensions you should startwith them until you can perform 4 sets of 12-15 reps for both.If you can do 4 sets of 15 reps of both, move on to planks until you can perform 3sets of 1 minute holds.If you can perform 3 sets of 1 minute holds for planks , move on to reverse planks, knee raises and side planks until you can perform 3 sets of 30 second holds forreverse and side planks and 4 sets of 12-15 reps for knee raises.From this point you’ll see how we’ll treat the rest of the core movements.The workout prescriptionFor this program, you’ll be alternating between two workouts:Workout A and Workout B.Week 1Monday : Workout AWednesday : Workout BFriday : Workout AWeek 2Monday : Workout BWednesday : Workout AFriday : Workout BThere are 9 levels that will be presented for these workouts.Choose your level based on what we discussed just now (the sets and reps youcan perform of the movements presented so far).ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 461
content: The warm up for each workout is the same and it is the followingWarm up-3setsx8-12 reps of front pull aparts (with a band)Rest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets-3setsx12-15 reps of internal rotations (with a band)Rest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets-3 sets 8-12reps of external rotations (with a band)Rest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets-3setsx12-15reps of band face pullsRest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets-3setsx8reps of wall anglesRest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets-3xHold the squat position for 15-30 seconds.Rest for 30 seconds between sets.-2-3x Sit on the floor with both legs out straight. Extend your arms and reachforward by bending at the waist as far as possible while keeping your kneesstraight. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.Rest for 30 seconds between sets.-3xStanding leg circle 8-12 reps clockwise and 8-12 reps counter clockwise. Norest. Back to back sets.-3xChild pose ( hold the position for 20-30 seconds).Rest for 30 seconds between sets.-2xKneeling hip flexor stretch if the hamstrings are still too tight ( hold theposition for 10-20 seconds).Rest for 30 seconds between sets.-3xPigeon pose (hold the position for 15-20 seconds).Rest for 30 seconds between sets.-3xKnee to chest ( hold the position for 10-20 seconds for each leg).Rest for 30 seconds between sets.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

content: 3.5 How women should train in order not to harm their healthAs with anyone, their training should be first broken down based on their trainingexperience.Beginner’s training split (training for under 1-2 years)Full body #1 / Rest / Full body #2/ Rest / Rest repeatThe warm up for both days is the following(The number on the left always symbolizes sets)-2setsx8-12 reps of front pull aparts (with a band) -2setsx12-15 reps of internal rotations (with a band)ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.-2xChild pose ( hold the position for 20-30 seconds).ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 496
content: Note: The first sets should always be sets with light weight and you shouldslowly increase the weight during the sets.Let’s say that you have a 100 pound squat max.What you should do then is start your first set with an empty bar or even yourown bodyweight for the reps mentioned on the first set.On your second set you should add 5-10 pounds on each side of the bar.On your third set you should add 10 pounds and so on.The same principle applies for every exercise.Warm upExercise 1Option A: Barbell squat (Make sure to engage your core during the entiremovement and never lift more weight than you can handle)Option B: Legs press1st set : 12-15 reps2nd set :10-12 reps3rd set : 8-10 reps4th set : 8-10 repsRest 2-3 minutes between setsExercise 2Leg curls1st set : 12-15 reps2nd set : 12 reps3rd set : 10-12 reps4th set : 10-12 repsRest 1-2 minutes between setsⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 524
content: 3.6 How to train when extremely busy.Stay in shape with only 30 minutes of exercise.A lot of times when i ask friendly clients how they got out of shape, a lot of timesthe answer was “i just didn’t have time for the gym man”.Of course this is the answer men give since women over complicate the exactsame answer to oblivion which is quite funny.We’ve all been super busy and most importantly we WILL be again and unlessyour job is physical labor you have to find 30 minutes a dayin totalin order toexercise.Realize this, you can still make gains by working out only for 20 - 30 minutes aday if you prioritize the right exercises and combine them in a specific way.The hands down most common pitfall most people get into when they try to get adecent workout in 20-30 minutes is that they are in a hurry.This is a one way ticket to injuries and ADHD through mega pumping adrenalineand cortisol.Just because your workouts will only take 20 to 30 minutes this does not meanthat you should be in a hurry.You should never try to “save time” on warm up or rest periods.You will snap something.We need to address 2 issues now.The first one is if you’ll be working out using your own bodyweight or weights?For this reason there will be two workout splits prescribed here. One for weightworkouts and one for bodyweight workouts.The second one is that if you workout at the gym, since this program is based onsaving time, you’ll be given multiple options in order to choose the least timeconsuming on a specific day in case the machines are taken by multiple peopleetc.ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 525
content: You are given 4 gym splits to choose from. title: Page 527
content: The splitsNote:The first set on each exercise will be your primingset.A set in which you will use the ¼-⅙ of your max weight depending on the exercise(if it’s a compound lift use the ⅙ metric, if it’s an isolation exercise the ¼) .If for example you have a 1 rep max of 200 kg in squats, you’ll warm up with30-40 kg.The last set will basically be your one true working set in which you should trulypush yourself.Split 1Chest & Back dayWarm up(You will perform these exercises with no rest between exercises and only10-15 seconds of rest between sets)-2setsx8-12 reps of band pass throughs-3setsx12-15 reps of internal rotations (with a band)-2 sets 8-12reps of external rotations (with a band)-2setsx12-15reps of band face pulls-2setsx8reps of wall angles-2setsx12reps of lower trap rope pulls.-2 sets of hanging from a pull bar for 20 seconds.-Optional 2 sets of 8 reps of the cat-cow exercise.Note: The band's resistance should be close to a moderate one and thetempo should not be a slow one.Try a 3-1-3 tempo for most exercises.Exercise 1Option A: Neutral grip chest press X Lat pulldownOption B: Incline DB bench X Rope pulloverⒸHelios_Movement LLC

content: Repeat3.8 How to train in order to fix your postureMost people sit in front of a computer most of the time and this of course will leadto posture problems among other things.So in order to fix this, i present to you a daily stretching routine that you canimplement and a specific way of training as well that will strengthen your posteriorchain which is crucial for proper posture.Some people develop improper posture simply because their training is wrong.If you want to have the maximum results of this, i recommend implementing thestretching routine 3 times a day.Stretching routine1) Cat-cow2) Child pose3) Thoracic spine extension4) Dead hangs5) Shoulder rolls6) Seated elbow grasp7) Neck tucks8) Trapezius stretch9) Levator scapulae stretch10) Shoulder blade squeeze (way more important than most people think) ⒸHelios_Movement LLC

title: Page 574
content: Felipe's diet and workout plan for phase ADISCLAIMER:This PDF does not provide medical advice.No content onthis PDF file is intended to substitute for professional medical advice,diagnosis, or treatment.Ideally, for the first phase you want to keep the followingfoods/supplements in your house:1)Blackseed oil2)Whole food vitamin C3)Thiamine (vitamin B1)4)Magnesium (any type except oxide)5)Glycine6)Ginkgo bilobaOptional niacinamide.If the bottles contain 60 servings each, they will last you over 5months the way that we use supplements.For the first phase we will focus on:1)Suboptimal gut health2)Unbound iron3)Suboptimal metabolic health4)Possible unhealthy mast cells5)Possible deficiencies in iron regulators and some mineralsDay 1 (Lifting day)Breakfast 1Ingredients●3-4 raw pasture raised eggs●2 teaspoons of coconut oil●2 handfuls of spinach●2 handfuls of white button mushrooms (finely chopped)●Handful of berries (any kind is acceptable) or cherries●2 handfuls of pumpkin, squash or 1 peach

title: Page 575
content: InstructionsFirst, place a pan on medium heat and add 1 teaspoon of coconut oil, crack theeggs, place a lid on top of the pan and wait until the egg whites are cooked butthe egg yolks remain almost soft.Then take out the eggs, add 1 more teaspoon of coconut oil and throw in thespinach and mushrooms which you willslowlycook veryvery well.After you’ve eaten the eggs and vegetables, consume 1 teaspoon of blackseedoil (wash it down with some filtered water).Then have the fruit at the end.Optional supplements●Thiamine●Small dose of magnesium (100-200mg)●Small dose (even 200mg) of vitamin C●Ginkgo bilobaLunchIngredients●300 grams of ground beef●1 teaspoon of blackseed oil●1-2 teaspoons of coconut oil●1 medium size sweet potato●Side of bone marrow if possible●Low vitamin C fruit of your choice (mango, banana etc)●Sea salt●Turmeric●Black pepper●Smoked paprika●OreganoInstructionsStep 1: Preheat the oven at 350.Step 2: Cut the sweet potato in small pieces, drizzle the coconut oil and throw itin.

title: Page 576
content: Step 3: Make patties out of the beef and spices and cook them in the oven untilthey are medium rare.Step 4: Take everything out and once again at the end of the meal consume 1teaspoon of blackseed oil.Snack●1-2 carrots (skin off)●Olives●BerriesDinnerIngredients●300 grams of shrimp (or white fish)●Bone broth rice (eat until full)●2 handfuls of berries●Sea salt●½-1 lemonInstructionsStep 1: Boil the shrimp for 2-4 minutes.Step 2: Throw the coconut oil in a skillet on high heat.Step 3: Throw the shrimp with the spices in and cook for a few minutes.Step 4: Add the lemon, take the shrimp out, place it on top of the bone broth riceand have the fruit on the side.Optional supplements●Magnesium glycinateNote: Also after day 1, DM me and let me know if thiswas too much or toolittle food in order to perhaps make some further adjustments.Day 2 (Non lifting day)Breakfast 2Ingredients●100-150 grams of beef liver

title: Page 577
content: ●½ an onion●1-2 teaspoons of coconut oil●Peaches, apricots, nectarines, mangos, squash, pumpkin or anything thatis high in beta carotene. The choice on day 2 is yours so you can havewhatever you like the most and is most convenient.●Sea salt●Turmeric●1 teaspoon of blackseed oil●Black pepperInstructionsStep 1: Place a skillet on high heat.Step 2: Add the coconut oil, onion and the liver. Season with the spices and waituntil everything is done.Step 3: Have the fruit on the side.Step 4: Consume the 1 teaspoon of blackseed oil at the end.The turmeric will help prevent the build up of unbound iron, but it will also improvethe absorption of vitamin D.Optional supplements●Ginkgo biloba●ThiamineLunchIngredients●Chicken thighs●1-2 teaspoons of coconut oil●2-3 medium size potatoes chop in small pieces (skin off)●2-3 handfuls of berries●Sea salt●Smoked paprikaStep 1: Preheat the oven at 350.Step 2: Cut the potatoes in small pieces, drizzle the coconut oil, spices and throwthem in.Step 3: Rub the chicken thighs with a bit of coconut oil and the spices.

title: Page 578
content: Step 4: Throw everything in the oven.Optional supplements●Whole food vitamin C●Low dose niacinamideDinner 2Ingredients●Oysters or mussels (eat until full)●Bone broth rice (eat until full)●2 zucchinis●Sea salt●Smoked paprika●Oregano●2 teaspoons of coconut oilStep 1: Preheat the oven at 350.Step 2: Cut the zucchinis in small pieces, drizzle the coconut oil, spices andthrow them in.Step 3: Wait until they’re cooked, place them on top of the bone broth rice andhave the shellfish on the side.Optional supplements●Magnesium glycinateDay 3 (Lifting day)Do not forget to perform your stretching routine before breakfast.Breakfast 3Ingredients●3-4 raw pasture raised egg yolks●2 teaspoons of coconut oil●½ of a ripe avocado●1 potato without the skin chopped very finely●Sea salt●Any seasonal fruit you want (remember to peel off the skin in case that it issomething like an apple (or even a pear)).

title: Page 579

title: Page 598
content: Pipe’s diet and workout plan for phase A (next 3-4 weeks)DISCLAIMER:This PDF does not provide medical advice.No content onthis PDF file is intended to substitute for professional medical advice,diagnosis, or treatment.Food list for the week-3 pounds of ground beef (if you like to purchase based on the fat ratio, then gofor the 80/20)-4-6 Chicken thighs-Coconut oil-Optional: Any type of bone in steak (except pork)-1-1.5 pounds of white fish-1 pound of shrimp-½ a pound of beef liver-Sardines canned in olive oil (2 cans)-18-20 free range eggs-A piece of ginger-4-6 carrots-1-2 avocados-Cacao-1 bag (the usually come in 1 pound bags) of frozen berries (any kind you like)or/and cherries-Pumpkin (you can purchase pre-boiled pumpkin, just make sure that it is notfilled with inferior fats such as canola oil and artificial sweeteners) or squash.You will need ⅓- ½ a pound-4 organic apples-1 bag of white jasmine rice (or any type of white rice that you enjoy)-5 medium size sweet potatoes and 5-7 regular ones-Optional: 2 Mangos, 4 peaches or 8-10 apricots (whichever you have found tobe digested the easiest and is more appetizing)-Sea salt-Turmeric-Oregano-Smoked paprika-Black pepper-Mushrooms (any kind you like) (you will not need much so purchase the smallestbag that you can find) and optional zucchinis (2-3)-Blackseed oil-Spinach (you will not need much so purchase the smallest bag that you can find)-Oysters or mussels (⅔ of a pound or a full pound (frozen ones are accepted))-2-3 lemons

title: Page 599
content: -Raw honey-Unflavoured goat’s whey (casein is also an option)-Apple pectin-Bone marrow bones-Any type of goat’s cheese (don’t get too much, 200 grams are enough).Supplement list for the next 3 weeks-Thiamine (50-100mg/capsule)-Liquid vitamin D + K2 if needed (the sun is rarely out where you live)-Magnesium glycinate-Whole food vitamin C-GlycineIf a supplement is not in the list, do not consume it (even if it is something likecreatine or a multivitamin (the reason behind this is in the educational material).Meal plan for the first 3-4 weeksDay 1(Lifting day)Breakfast 1Ingredients●3-4 raw pasture raised egg yolks●1 teaspoon of coconut oil●1-2 teaspoons of raw honey●Handful of berries (any kind is acceptable) or cherries●Handful of pumpkin●Some apple pectin (look at the package for the dosage)●1 tablespoon of cacao (optional)●Dash of cinnamon (optional)InstructionsGrab a bowl, throw in the cacao, the pectin, the coconut oil, the honey, the eggyolks and some filtered water.Mix until a fine paste has been made. Add the fruit and top it off with somecinnamon.No supplements should be consumed with this breakfast due to the bindingeffects of apple pectin.

content: If you are afraid of eating raw egg yolks, then you can simply boil the eggs,season them with sea salt and have them before eating the bowl of cacao, rawhoney and fruit.If you don’t want to waste the egg whites, simply throw 1 teaspoon of coconut oilin the bowl instead of 2 and then throw 1 teaspoon of coconut oil in a pan, cookthe egg whites and add some sea salt.Lunch 1Ingredients●200-400 grams of ground beef●1 tablespoon of blackseed oil●1 tablespoon of coconut oil●1 medium size sweet potato●Side of bone marrow●Optional mango●Sea salt●Smoked paprika●OreganoInstructionsStep 1: Preheat the oven at 350.Step 2: Cut the sweet potato in small pieces, drizzle the coconut oil and throw itin.Step 3: Make patties out of the beef and spices and cook them in the oven untilthey are medium rare (trial and error process). Well done red meat is very veryhard to digest.Step 4: Drizzle the blackseed oil on the patties when they are done and serve thesweet potato and mango on the side.Note: Instead of the mango you can use any low vitamin C fruit you want.Drink in between meals●Ginger teaSnack(You can have it any time during the day youwant)Ingredients●2 scoops of whey (or casein)●Handful of berries

content: Optional supplements●Thiamine●Liquid vitamin D + K2Lunch 7Ingredients●100-200 grams of beef liver●½-1 onion●1-2 teaspoons of coconut oil●Sea salt●Black pepper●Turmeric●1 medium size sweet potato●Teaspoon of raw honeyInstructionsStep 1: Preheat the oven on 350 and then add the sweet potato which you havechopped in small pieces.Step 2: Plane a skillet at high heat.Step 3: Throw in the coconut oil, the onion and liver with the spices.Step 4: Take the sweet potato out, add the raw honey and place it next to theliver.Dinner 7Ingredients●200-300 grams of white fish or shrimp●Optional spinach (2-3 handfuls in a pan)●1 tablespoon of blackseed oil●Sea salt●White rice●1-2 teaspoons of coconut oil●1 lemon

title: Page 612
content: InstructionsStep 1: Preheat the oven at 350, rub the fish with a bit of coconut oil, season withsea salt and add them in.Step 2: Throw coconut oil in a skillet on high heat.Step 3: Throw the asparagus, season them with sea salt and add the lemon juice.Step 4: Take the asparagus out and add the black seed oil.Step 5: Take the fish out, place them on top of the rice and you are done.Optional supplements●Magnesium glycinateRepeat the meal plan from day 1.Note: Here’s how you make bone broth the easy way.Get 2-3kg of marrow bones.Put the bones in a large stock pot and cover them with cold water. Bring them toboil and simmer for 15 minutes in high heat. Then drain and rinse the bones withwater.Preheat the oven to 200 celsius and place the bones in a roasting pan. Roast for35-45 minutes. Transfer the bones back to the stockpot. (Make sure to wash yourpots after the bones are blanched and drained.) Fill the pot with water until thebones are fully submerged. Cover the pots and bring to a boil. Reduce heat tolow and simmer for at least 6-12 hours ( add more water if needed). Once thebones have simmered and your broth is ready, you will need to strain the broththrough a strainer. Add as much sea salt as you want and you’re done. Store thebone broth inside sealed jars in the freezer.

title: Page 613
content: Workout program (for when you’re back at the gym)Daily mobility routine (non negotiable)You are going to perform the following exercises/stretches in a cyclicalmanner for 3-4 sets in total every day.-Hanging from a pull up bar by using a narrow grip (this is important) foraround 10-15 seconds (do a trial and error) before your forearms giveup.-Child pose hold for 20 seconds. -Hold the deep squat position for 20 seconds. -Knee to the opposite shoulder (glute stretch) hold for 15-25 seconds oneach leg.

title: Page 614
content: -Kneeling lunge hip stretch hold for 15-20 seconds on each leg. -Upper trap stretch on a chair hold for 10-15 seconds on each side.

title: Page 615
content: -Seated trapezius stretch hold for 10-15 seconds.

title: Page 616
content: 6) Levator scapulae stretch hold for 10-15 seconds. 7) Superman hyperextensions2-3 sets of 12-15 reps Bodyweight neck training in order to keep the posture safe.Don’t forget that the most common mistake when training the neck is notperforming the exercises at a full range of motion.

title: Page 617
content: This means that after each rep, your neck should return to neutral position beforestarting the next rep (see the picture at the end of the neck training regime).Exercise 1: Flexion1st set: 6-15 reps2nd set 15 reps3rd set: 15-20 repsRest 30 seconds - 1 minute between setsExercise 2: Lateral flexionThe reps mentioned are for each side1st set: 6-8 reps2nd set 10-15 reps3rd set: 15 repsRest 30 seconds - 1 minute between setsExercise 3: RotationThe reps mentioned are for each side1st set: 6-8 reps2nd set 10-15 reps3rd set: 15 repsRest 30 seconds - 1 minute between setsExercise 4: Extension1st set: 6-15 reps2nd set 15 reps3rd set: 15-20 repsRest 30 seconds - 1 minute between sets

title: Page 618
content: If the rest periods are again too short, feel free to add a few more secondsof rest time.

content: Lifting regime for the next 3-4 weeksDay 1Warm up-3setsx8-12 reps of front pull aparts (with a band)Rest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets

title: Page 621
content: -2setsx8reps of wall angles -3setsx12-15reps of band face pullsRest 30 seconds-1 minute between sets-Optional: 3setsx8-12 reps of thoracic spine extensionsRest 30 seconds between sets-3 sets of 5 seconds before failure of dead handsRest 30 seconds - 1 minute between setsExercise 1: Slight incline DB pressReminders: When it comes to pressing in general, never press at a 90degree angle. You want to target the chest, you are not interested inpowerlifting or further destroying your shoulders.You should not practice the full range of motion as well, you want to keep itat ⅚ in order to keep the tension on the chest during the entire movement.

title: Page 622
content: Keep your wrists straight while pushing, use a 3-1-3 tempo (3 seconds up, 1second pause, 3 seconds down) to press and squeeze your scapula insidethe bench/machine during the entire movement.1st set : 12-15 reps2nd set: 10-12 reps3rd set: 10 reps reps4th set: 8-10 reps reps5th set: 6-8 reps reps + drop set at another 8-10 repsRest 3 minutes between sets and hang from a pull up bar in between setsanywhere from 10-20 seconds.Rest 1 minute and move on to the next exerciseExercise 2: Pull ups / Assisted pull upsReminder: When you pull, you should pull from a 50-60 degree angle inorder to properly target the lats and with 1 second squeeze at the top ofeach rep.4 sets: 8-12 repsRest 2 minutes between setsRest 1 minute and move on to the next exerciseExercise 3: Incline DB rows X Push ups (very slowand controlled and donot forget tonotpress at a 90 degree angle and mentallyfocus on yourweaker side as well).Reminders: When it comes to rows, keep your head at a neutral positionand do not go all the way down (go all the way up, but stop just before yourshoulders are about to lock out).1st set : 12-15 X 12-15 reps2nd set: 12 X15 reps3rd set: 10-12 X 12 reps4th set: 10-12 X 12 repsRest 2-3 minutes between sets
